com.googlecode.javacpp.annotation

Annotation Type Adapter


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={METHOD,PARAMETER,ANNOTATION_TYPE})
public @interface Adapter
    Specifies a C++ class to act as an adapter to convert the types of arguments. Two such C++ classes made available by Generator are StringAdapter and VectorAdapter, to bridge a few differences between std::string and String; and between std::vector, Java arrays of primitive types, and Pointer. Adapter classes must define the following public members:
    • A constructor accepting 2 arguments (or more if argc() > 1): a pointer and a size
    • Another constructor that accepts a reference to the object of the other class
    • A static void deallocate(pointer) function
    • Overloaded cast operators to both types, for references and pointers
    • A void assign(pointer, size) function
    • A size member variable for arrays accessed via pointer
    To reduce further the amount of coding, this annotation can also be used on other annotations, such as with StdString and StdVector.
    Author:
    Samuel Audet
    See Also:
    Generator

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      The name of the C++ adapter class.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      int argc
      The number of arguments that Generator takes from the method as arguments to the adapter constructor.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The name of the C++ adapter class.

      • argc

        public abstract int argc
        The number of arguments that Generator takes from the method as arguments to the adapter constructor.
        Default:
        1
